A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: When I first saw The Last Jedi I left the theater feeling entertained\, but confused. I wasn't really sure how to react to what I just experienced. I felt similar when I first saw The Force Awakens. The difference is after a few days of contemplation I realized I really enjoyed The Force Awakens (despite how much of a retread some of it was). With The Last Jedi a feeling of overall enjoyment never arrived. The movie was visually amazing with great cinematography. Rian Johnson did great at that aspect. There are some scenes I absolutely loved. There are other scenes that are simply stupid. The more you think about them the more ridiculous they seem. I wish someone else had written the movie script itself. The story was strange (and not in a good way)\, loaded with plot holes\, and basically threw out everything set up by The Force Awakens. It feels like a sloppy mess and certainly doesn't fit with the other existing movies. If Rian had been creating a standalone movie that would maybe have worked\, but as part of a series\, this movies is a miss.
